caption: This photograph features a prominently displayed wooden sign placed in the foreground, painted with the message "SORRY NO GAS" in red lettering. The sign appears makeshift, crafted from a light-colored wood and standing on what seems to be a roadside or pavement. The background is slightly out of focus, illustrating a typical street scene with cars driving along the road and traffic lights visible in the distance. Trees line the edge of the street, contributing to a suburban setting. It seems to be overcast or dusk given a little subdued lighting, emphasizing the sign's message as possibly related to a time of fuel shortage or a similar crisis. Overall, the composition communicates a clear message regarding the unavailability of gasoline, positioned in a common roadway environment where such a sign would be relevant.
title: Signs like this have begun to appear frequently in the Portland area.
